alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Northern Jackson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 8:54AM EST until January 29 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Buncombe and Northern Jackson Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Extremely cold wind chills can cause serious health problems including hypothermia and rapid frostbite during short time periods without proper precautions taken. If you must spend extended periods outdoors, cover extremities and be conscious of body temperature.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
